abstract: The biggest European bank reported net income of $7.7 billion in the first half of 2008 as loan impairment charges and other credit risk provisions increased 58 percent.
snippet: The biggest European bank reported net income of $7.7 billion in the first half of 2008 as loan impairment charges and other credit risk provisions increased 58 percent.
lead_paragraph: HSBC Holdings, the biggest European bank, reported a 29 percent decline in profit for the first six months on Monday, saying that the business environment remained uncertain and that growth in emerging markets was expected to slow.

headline.main: HSBC Warns of Challenges as Its Profit Drops 29%
headline.print_headline: HSBC Warns Of Challenges As Its Profit Drops 29%
